passages.text: Hey look! A dragon pup!

Oh no, it's afflicted with 'The Curse'
We're going to have to take you to the Grand Wizard Abracadabraham in The Misty Mountains!
Looks like we're going to be traveling a while, what shall I name you?
I'll call you... Wally !
I'll call you... Melissa!

Well you are a dragon, and look really awesome… How about [The Drag Queen]!
Yeah! That sounds amazing, people are going to be terrified of you.

You spot a broken down wagon with some people nearby. They look half starved, they've been stuck for a while.
Please take us to the nearest town and let us borrow some supplies, we have plenty of money!

options.text: Offer supplies, and let them hitch a ride to town (-2S)
I can help fix their wagon! (Margaret)
Let me take care of 'em, you want the money right? (Geiger)

passages.text: We can't thank you enough, please take this for your troubles, +200g
Margaret works her mechanical prowess and soon the wagon is fixed! Thank you, so much! Here take this, it's all we have, +200g, + a good luck charm
The domineering presence of Geiger is enough for them to freeze. Geiger walks over, takes their money, and you make your merry way, +200g
They probably aren't in too much trouble anyways
You notice a speck of red a few miles down the plains. A few minutes later, you find that speck of red everywhere. There’s a grasslands fire, the smoke is starting to choke you out.!

options.text: There's a path over there! Quickly! (Mary)
Force your way through the fire

passages.text:
You look around for another way, but the fire goes for miles in each direction, 
 there doesn’t seem to be a way around this.

You notice a small path of cobblestone which cuts right through the fire, but the path is quickly closing. It’s now or never! 
 That was close, but you made it to the other side unscathed and notice a town not far away 
 That will make a good resting point

You take a small path of cobblestone which cuts right through the fire, but the path is quickly closing. It’s now or never! 
 That was close, but you made it to the other side unscathed and notice a town not far away 
 That will make a good resting point

You hold your breath for what feels like forever as your steed and wagon barrel through the raging fire. 
 Undoubtedly no sane person would have ever made this choice. 
 Your wagon is in shambles and your horse collapses of heat exhaustion and smoke inhalation.

there’s a small path of cobblestone which cuts right through the fire, 
 you take your time, 
 you were in no real danger.

A few moments later the world starts to take standard form again, and you feel normal. 
 I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off! You head towards the nearby town that was your destination.

Thankfully, there’s a town about a mile out where you can purchase a new wagon 
Welcome to Stable Hands, the wagon/horse shop with the most stable hands, you look like you just came out of a fire.

options.text: Thanks I need a new wagon and a horse >

passages.text:
Alright that will be 800g worth of goods for a normal horse and wagon, 
 but if you’d like we have a special breed of horse that can run twice as fast for 2,000g flat.

options.text: Pay 400g and 4 supplies for the normal horse >

passages.text: You receive a wagon and the ‘Special Horse’
You receive a wagon and a horse, you’re ready to ride!

Alright listen, I'm not here to argue, you can have our lame horse if you want for free, 
 but he is pretty damn slow. 
 It’s not much better, but it’s something
You recieved a wagon and a lame horse!

You stumble upon an old man carrying a heavy pack, there are trinkets and baubles dangling on the outside of the bursting to the brim backpack. 
 A travelling merchant! 
 Good evening! Could I trouble you for a cup of tea and some company?

Only a fool would turn down a travelling merchant! You pull over for a while to make tea and company. 
 You have a hearty chat before he settles enough to show you his wares. 
 Only one item per customer, see anything you like?

options.text: Is that a Crystal of Purity in your pack? (Seer's Vision)  >

passages.text:
Hmm.. that looks delicious! You pay the merchant and receive the item. 
 Ooh very nice, that was home made! 
 Good luck on your adventure!

Hmm.. that looks useful! You pay the merchant and receive the item. 
 Ooh very nice, that will certainly help you in a pinch! 
 Good luck on your adventure!

Ah! You have a good eye, unfortunately people don't really need these anymore, I've been lugging it around for ages, 
 I'd be delighted to give this one to you on the house.

A few moments later the world starts to take standard form again, and you feel normal. 
 I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off!
You see an army marching in formation. The kingsmen can only mean trouble, you continue your way and hope they don’t bother you.
HAALLTTT

If you’re even THINKING of passing through THIS AREA without paying the TOLL, 
 You and I are going to be having ONE VERY unpleasant chat. 

 Why do army sergeants always have to scream?
Thank you for your SUPPORT to the KING in these HARD TIMES.

Oh of course I can pay th- Whats that over there?! 
 You make a quick run while the sergeant is distracted
GET THEM!!!!!!

You gallop as fast as you can, but the distraction wasn’t enough for a perfect escape. 
 You manage to get away with minor graze wounds from arrows. 
 The stress seems to be getting to poor Dragon
PLEASE GET OUT OF THE WAGON TO CHAT

NOW YOU SEE HERE, WE’LL let you go JUST this ONCE, but PLEASE remember to PAY THE TOLL PROPERLY next time. AS IT IS WRITTEN, "For the UPHOLDING and KEEPING all Churches and Chapels and the DOMINION OF THE KING over these lands:

It is ORDERED and ORDAINED by the lords and commons assembled in parliament, that FOUR, three, TWO, or ONE SUBSTANTIAL inhabitants or inhabitants crossing such tolled lands, of every PARISH or CHAPELRY aforesaid (Having respect to the PROPORTIONS of Greatness of EVERY SUCH Parish or Chapelry)

Shall be NOMINATED and CHOSEN DAILY, on any tolled traveling land, by the Sergeant of every ARMY serving the KING (Which are or shall be rateable to the Repair of any such Army in the Kingdom), or the GREATEST PART OF SUCH of them as Shall be then ASSEMBLED for the CHOICE OF OFFICERS within the PARISH or army to be Churchwarden or Churchwardens or COLLECTOR OF MONIES for ROYAL DUTIES, within every such Parish or Army respectively where any such Churchwarden or Churchwardens HAVE or HATH been FORMERLY used to be NOMINATED or CHOSEN;

or, in default hereof, every such PARISH or traveler shall FORFEIT the Sum of 50g to the Use of the KING of the said Parish, to be recovered as is hereafter expressed; which Churchwardens or Collectors, so to be chosen, are within ONE MONTH after their CHOICE to be allowed and APPROVED of under the hands and SEALS of two OF the next JUSTICES adjoining to the Parish or Chapelry AFORESAID.

and it is further ORDAINED, that the CHURCHWARDENS or COLLECTORS aforesaid, together with the OVERSEERS of the POOR of the same Parish or Chapelry or the greater PART OF THEM, upon PUBLIC NOTICE thereof first to be given by the Churchwardens in the said Church or Chapel,

options.text: I think I made a mistake >

passages.text: Shall from TIME TO TIME make RATES, or assessments, by TAXATION of every Inhabitant dwelling or residing within such PARISH or CHAPELRY, and of EVERY occupier of Lands, Houses, Tithes Impropriate or Impropriation of Tithes, Coal-mines, or saleable Underwoods, or other Hereditaments, within the said Parish or CHAPELRY,

options.text: I get it, I get it.. >

passages.text: in such competent Sum and Sums of Money as THEY SHALL think fit, for AND towards THE Reparation and Maintenance of every such Parish Church or Chapel RESPECTIVELY, and PROVIDING of BOOKS for the SAID CHURCH OR CHAPEL, and of BREAD and WINE TO be USED at the ADMINISTRATION of the Sacrament.…

ALRIGHT, just promise to pay next time and BE ON YOUR WAY 
 What was he even talking about??
You see the remnants of an ancient battlefield.

options.text: I bet I can find something valuable (James)
Ahah, a perfect time for my magic detector!

passages.text: You gather as many shiny objects as you can, you find shields and weapons that you think might be valuable [+100g]
You find some extremely hardtack. It’s unpleasant, but will do in a pinch [+1 Supplies]
James comes back with the crown of an old king [+250g]
Beep. Beep. Beep...
You dig at the spot you can feel something buried, and find a Heart Stone! Yes! This should fuel a Crystal of Purity!
The world starts to take standard form again, and you feel normal. I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off!
Beep. Beep. Beeeeeeeep...
Beepbeepbeepbeepbeepbeep!
You dig under the hotspot for the Magic Detector and find a Heart Stone! Yes! This should fuel the Crystal of Purity!!
A field of Goldenberries! I’ve only ever heard of them! They’re supposed to be delicious!

options.text: Woah, a whole field of goldenberries, let me make sure they're safe (mary)

passages.text: You eat your fill on delicious Goldenberries, and take some for the road. +1 Supplies

You start feeling a little queasy… I don’t think those were Goldenberries, you throw the rest out -1 Supplies 
 Those couldn’t have been good for you.

You start feeling a little queasy… Just as you’re getting ready to hurl, the world changes colors! You feel as though you could see things you couldn’t before, it’s a strange sensation that you’re overall not a fan of. You throw out the rest of the berries and hope this isn’t permanent 
 -1 Supplies + Seer's Vision
Wow! Real goldenberries, apparantly the leaves and stalks are delicious too!

Wow, you almost made a mistake! These are Fool’s Goldenberries, the much more common variety that are mildly toxic. Making a jam out of them should squeeze the poison out. 
 Too bad they weren’t real Goldenberries +1 Supplies
I’ve only ever heard of these! Vermeil Goldenberries. Said to be a legend, those who eat these can see through natural oddities with Seer’s Vision.

options.text: I'm gonna have to eat that >

passages.text: Wow! I haven’t seen real goldenberries in the field before! Let me help you gather as much as we can!
See the clustering of the berries? It’s very similar to how Goldenberries are suppose to look, but these are Fool’s Goldenberries, you shouldn’t eat them raw, but we can make a jam out of them
I’ve only ever heard of these! Vermeil Goldenberries. Said to be a legend, those who eat these can see through natural oddities with Seer’s Vision. Let’s eat some!
You arrive at a town that you thought was supposed to be bustling with life. Instead you find a ghost town that looks like it’s been abandoned for a few year. The place is giving you the creeps.

options.text: Take what you can and leave

passages.text: You find a storehouse with a few supplies (+1S)
You find some nobles house and take a few of the small shiny objects (+50g)

James explains:
This was an old witches town that was thriving until the reign of the new king. The king sent an army to force the witches out and the town has been abandoned ever since. A long line of prestigious witches used to live here. James runs off to a manor near the center of town and comes back with bundles of old spell tomes and gold (+300g)

You wander up to a manor near the center of town, and in one of the spires you find an Orb of Truesight! (+Orb) The world starts to take standard form again, and you feel normal. I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off!

There seems to be a revolution going on in this town. People have taken up arms and a guillotine and have flooded the streets. The nobles are screaming for help from the top of their villas. This seems like a domestic dispute, but nobles are known for having lots of wealth...

options.text: Help the people execute the nobles
I can take care of this mob (Geiger)

passages.text:
You push into the crowds and screaming ‘VIVA LA REVOLUCIÓN’.
After making your way to the nobles and you force them into the guillotine.
After spilling the nobles blood and splitting the nobles wealth equally between everyone, you make a profit of 17g (+17g)
You shout ‘HEY, THEY’RE GETTING AWAY’ and point in the opposite direction. The crowd blindly follows your orders and you manage to catch up to the nobles who are fleeing in the opposite direction.
With the grace of a giant man with a giant sword, Geiger cleaves through large swathes of townsfolk. You watch in horror from your wagon, unable to lift a finger against the carnage that unfolds.
You decide not to get involved in the politics of this dangerous town and just keep riding.

The nobles scoff,
"Money? How am I supposed to know you’re the one who caused that distraction, besides, it’s my money and I deserve it. Now bugger off!"

When the dust (or rather, the mist of fresh blood) settles, Geiger jaunts back toward the wagon, casually proclaiming,
"Mm, got the nobles as well, I’m keepin’ his money though."
(You begin to see why there was a revolution...)
You don’t dare to say anything and set back onto the road.
